verses.verse: Now it came to pass after <S%H310>this<s%>, that <S%H5176>Nahash<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> of the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> <S%H4191>died<s%>, and his <S%H1121>son<s%> <S%H4427>reigned<s%> in his stead.

And <S%H1732>David<s%> <S%H559>said<s%>, I will <S%H6213>shew<s%> <S%H2617>kindness<s%> unto <S%H2586>Hanun<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H5176>Nahash<s%>, because his <S%H1>father<s%> <S%H6213>shewed<s%> <S%H2617>kindness<s%> to me. And <S%H1732>David<s%> <S%H7971>sent<s%> <S%H4397>messengers<s%> to <S%H5162>comfort<s%> him concerning his <S%H1>father<s%>. So the <S%H5650>servants<s%> of <S%H1732>David<s%> <S%H935>came<s%> into the <S%H776>land<s%> of the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> to <S%H2586>Hanun<s%>, to <S%H5162>comfort<s%> him.

But the <S%H8269>princes<s%> of the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H2586>Hanun<s%>, <S%H5869>Thinkest<s%> thou that <S%H1732>David<s%> doth <S%H3513>honour<s%> thy <S%H1>father<s%>, that he hath <S%H7971>sent<s%> <S%H5162>comforters<s%> unto thee? are not his <S%H5650>servants<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> unto thee for to <S%H2713>search<s%>, and to <S%H2015>overthrow<s%>, and to spy <S%H7270>out<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%>?

Wherefore <S%H2586>Hanun<s%> <S%H3947>took<s%> <S%H1732>David's<s%> <S%H5650>servants<s%>, and <S%H1548>shaved<s%> them, and cut <S%H3772>off<s%> their <S%H4063>garments<s%> in the <S%H2677>midst<s%> hard by their <S%H4667>buttocks<s%>, and sent them <S%H7971>away<s%>.

Then there <S%H3212>went<s%> certain, and <S%H5046>told<s%> <S%H1732>David<s%> how the <S%H582>men<s%> were served. And he <S%H7971>sent<s%> to <S%H7125>meet<s%> them: for the <S%H582>men<s%> were <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H3637>ashamed<s%>. And the <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H3427>Tarry<s%> at <S%H3405>Jericho<s%> until your <S%H2206>beards<s%> be <S%H6779>grown<s%>, and then <S%H7725>return<s%>.

¶ And when the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> that they had made themselves <S%H887>odious<s%> to <S%H1732>David<s%>, <S%H2586>Hanun<s%> and the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> <S%H7971>sent<s%> a <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H3603>talents<s%> of <S%H3701>silver<s%> to <S%H7936>hire<s%> them <S%H7393>chariots<s%> and <S%H6571>horsemen<s%> out of <S%H763>Mesopotamia<s%>, and out of <S%H758%H4601>Syria-maachah<s%>, and out of <S%H6678>Zobah<s%>.

So they <S%H7936>hired<s%> <S%H7970>thirty<s%> and <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H7393>chariots<s%>, and the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H4601>Maachah<s%> and his <S%H5971>people<s%>; who <S%H935>came<s%> and <S%H2583>pitched<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H4311>Medeba<s%>. And the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> gathered themselves <S%H622>together<s%> from their <S%H5892>cities<s%>, and <S%H935>came<s%> to <S%H4421>battle<s%>.
And when <S%H1732>David<s%> <S%H8085>heard<s%> of it, he <S%H7971>sent<s%> <S%H3097>Joab<s%>, and all the <S%H6635>host<s%> of the mighty <S%H1368>men<s%>.

And the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> came <S%H3318>out<s%>, and put the <S%H4421>battle<s%> in <S%H6186>array<s%> before the <S%H6607>gate<s%> of the <S%H5892>city<s%>: and the <S%H4428>kings<s%> that were <S%H935>come<s%> were by themselves in the <S%H7704>field<s%>.

Now when <S%H3097>Joab<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> that the <S%H4421>battle<s%> was set against him <S%H6440>before<s%> and <S%H268>behind<s%>, he chose <S%H977>out<s%> of all the <S%H977>choice<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, and put them in <S%H6186>array<s%> <S%H7125>against<s%> the <S%H758>Syrians<s%>.

And the <S%H3499>rest<s%> of the <S%H5971>people<s%> he <S%H5414>delivered<s%> unto the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H52>Abishai<s%> his <S%H251>brother<s%>, and they set themselves in <S%H6186>array<s%> <S%H7125>against<s%> the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%>.

And he <S%H559>said<s%>, If the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> be too <S%H2388>strong<s%> for me, then thou shalt <S%H8668>help<s%> me: but if the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> be too <S%H2388>strong<s%> for thee, then I will <S%H3467>help<s%> thee.

Be of good <S%H2388>courage<s%>, and let us behave ourselves <S%H2388>valiantly<s%> for our <S%H5971>people<s%>, and for the <S%H5892>cities<s%> of our <S%H430>God<s%>: and let the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H6213>do<s%> that which is <S%H2896>good<s%> in his <S%H5869>sight<s%>.

So <S%H3097>Joab<s%> and the <S%H5971>people<s%> that were with him drew <S%H5066>nigh<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> unto the <S%H4421>battle<s%>; and they <S%H5127>fled<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> him.

And when the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> that the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> were <S%H5127>fled<s%>, they likewise <S%H5127>fled<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H52>Abishai<s%> his <S%H251>brother<s%>, and <S%H935>entered<s%> into the <S%H5892>city<s%>. Then <S%H3097>Joab<s%> <S%H935>came<s%> to <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>.

¶ And when the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> that they were put to the <S%H5062>worse<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, they <S%H7971>sent<s%> <S%H4397>messengers<s%>, and drew <S%H3318>forth<s%> the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> that were <S%H5676>beyond<s%> the <S%H5104>river<s%>: and <S%H7780>Shophach<s%> the <S%H8269>captain<s%> of the <S%H6635>host<s%> of <S%H1928>Hadarezer<s%> went <S%H6440>before<s%> them.

And it was <S%H5046>told<s%> <S%H1732>David<s%>; and he <S%H622>gathered<s%> all <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, and passed <S%H5674>over<s%> <S%H3383>Jordan<s%>, and <S%H935>came<s%> upon them, and set the battle in <S%H6186>array<s%> against them. So when <S%H1732>David<s%> had put the <S%H4421>battle<s%> in <S%H6186>array<s%> <S%H7125>against<s%> the <S%H758>Syrians<s%>, they <S%H3898>fought<s%> with him.

But the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> <S%H5127>fled<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H3478>Israel<s%>; and <S%H1732>David<s%> <S%H2026>slew<s%> of the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> <S%H7651>seven<s%> <S%H505>thousand<s%> men which fought in <S%H7393>chariots<s%>, and <S%H705>forty<s%> <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H376%H7273>footmen<s%>, and <S%H4191>killed<s%> <S%H7780>Shophach<s%> the <S%H8269>captain<s%> of the <S%H6635>host<s%>.

And when the <S%H5650>servants<s%> of <S%H1928>Hadarezer<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> that they were put to the <S%H5062>worse<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, they made <S%H7999>peace<s%> with <S%H1732>David<s%>, and became his <S%H5647>servants<s%>: neither <S%H14>would<s%> the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> <S%H3467>help<s%> the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> any more.
